articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin will mount a counteroffensive to try to retake territory in the Kursk region captured by Ukrainian troops, but Russian forces will encounter "a difficult fight," Deputy CIA Director David Cohen said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Russia faces "difficult fight" to retake Ukraine-held area, says top US spy

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces sent tanks deeper into Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip and launched strikes across the enclave as they battled Hamas-led militants, killing at least 34 Palestinians on Wednesday, according to medics.
articles.title: Israeli forces launch strikes across Gaza, push tanks into central Khan Younis

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Antoni Slodkowski
articles.description: Top Chinese and U.S. officials discussed holding fresh talks between Presidents Joe Biden and Xi Jinping in the near future, the two countries said on Wednesday during high-level meetings in Beijing.
articles.title: Chinese, US officials discuss new round of talks between Biden and Xi

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli strikes in the West Bank killed at least nine people, Palestinian health authorities said on Wednesday, in a major operation in the occupied territory.
articles.title: Israeli operation in the West Bank kills at least 9, Palestinian officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French investigative judges are due to decide later on Wednesday whether to place Russian-born Telegram boss Pavel Durov under formal investigation following his arrest as part of a probe into organised crime on the messaging app.
articles.title: French judges to decide on next step in Durov probe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian drones set oil tanks on fire at an depot in Russia's Rostov region, Russian Telegram channels reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: Ukraine drones set oil depot ablaze in Russia's Rostov region, Telegram channels say

articles.author: Kaori Kaneko
articles.description: Southwestern Japan braced on Wednesday for what officials say could be one of the strongest storms to ever hit the region, as some residents in the path of Typhoon Shanshan were ordered to evacuate and major firms like Toyota closed factories.
articles.title: Japan issues emergency warning as powerful Typhoon Shanshan nears

articles.author: Mariela Nava, Tibisay Romero
articles.description: Dueling rallies were set to take place in Venezuela on Wednesday, as both the opposition and the ruling party urged supporters to mark the one-month anniversary of last month's disputed election and arrests of opposition figures continued.
articles.title: Dueling rallies expected in Venezuela to mark one month of disputed election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ship engineer Tim Parker Eaton is the second crew member from British tech tycoon Mike Lynch's sunken superyacht to be placed under investigation by Italian prosecutors, a judicial source said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Ship engineer from Lynch's sunken yacht also under investigation, legal source says

articles.author: Alexandros Avramidis
articles.description: Greek authorities have started collecting hundreds of thousands of dead fish that poured into a tourist port in the central city of Volos this week after being displaced from their usual freshwater habitats during flooding last year.
articles.title: Dead fish blanket Greek tourist port after flooding
